name: North End Grill's Bloody Mary Mix
description: A basic tomato base for a Bloody Mary, seasoned with horseradish, citrus, and hot sauce.
recipeYield: Makes about 1 3/4 quarts bloody mary mix
recipeIngredient: 2 (28-ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, preferably San Marzano (see note)
4 ounces (1/2 cup) fresh lemon juice from 4 to 5 lemons
3 ounces (6 tablespoons) fresh lime juice from 6 to 8 limes
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Place tomatoes and their juice in a medium saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat to low. Cover partially with a lid and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced by about 1/3, about 4 hours. Add horseradish, then transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Let cool.
Combine tomato base with lemon juice, lime juice, Worcestershire, Dijon, and hot sauce. Season to taste with salt and lots of black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.
